content: the yesteryear hat is featured on the ** clover-usa blog 1 ** as a free pattern this pattern is reversible you can roll the brim on one side and fold it on the other you can style it any way you want be it with a rolled brim folded brim or slouchy hat the choice is yours a three-in-one hat style is amazing isn t it skill level intermediate materials super bulky 6 weight yarn approximately 90 yards crochet hook size m/n | 9 mm or size to obtain gauge scissors tape measure tapestry needle stitch marker gauge 10 sts x 9 rounds = 4 inches see pattern notes on how to crochet gauge in the round finished measurement approximately 10 height x 19 diameter unstretched stitches and abbreviations | us terminology chain s chain s flo front loop only fsc foundation single_crochet pm place marker repeat - repeat slip_stitch s slip_stitch es st s stitch es hslst half_double_crochet slip_stitch hslst2tog - half_double_crochet slip_stitch 2 together notes 1 read the pattern carefully before starting 2 this pattern is worked from the bottom up in continuous rounds spiral 3 i recommend using a stitch marker to mark the 1st stitch of each round remember to move stitch markers as you progress 4 the asterisk * indicates pattern repeats you will need to repeat all the instructions from the asterisks 5 this pattern can be easily modified to your preferred size i suggest that when modifying the size of your beanie increase or decrease your foundation sts by 4 this is just so your decreases crown of the beanie will have even numbers of sts if you want your beanie to be more fitted or slouchier add/subtract a few rounds to the body of the beanie before continuing with the decreases or shaping of the crown 6 helpful youtube video tutorial by yarnique on how to crochet gauge in the round click here to watch i would love to see your yesteryear hat version please tag me @stringsandcuddles and use these hashtags to share #stringsandcuddles #stringsandcuddlesdesigns #yesteryearhat please don t hesitate to reach out with questions regarding this pattern 1 https //blog clover-usa com/2024/01/24/yesteryear-retro-beanie-pattern/
